data.title: A. James Clark School of Engineering, University of Maryland
data.text:
"Literary Reading with UM's William Henry Lewis"

Monday, February 23, 2009

2:00 p.m.-3:00 p.m.

Room 0120 Conference Room, Nyumburu Cultural Ctr

Tunji Sawyer, MBA

301 405 5619

tsawyer@umd.edu

http://www.omse.umd.edu

"Literary Reading with UM's William Henry Lewis"

Join the Office of Multi-Ethnic Student Education for an exciting opportunity to hear the literary works of acclaimed author William Henry Lewis.

"William Henry Lewis Literary Reading"

February 23, 2009, 2 p.m. - 3 p.m.

Room 0120 Conference Room, Nyumburu Cultural Center

William Henry Lewis is a faculty member in Masters in Fine Arts Program in Creative Writing at the University of Maryland. He is the prizewinning author of a previous story collection, In the Arms of Our Elders. His fiction has appeared in America's top literary journals and several anthologies. His awards include a prize for short fiction from the Zora Neale Hurston/Richard Wright Foundation. He was a finalist for the 2005 PEN Faulkner Prize for Fiction, and is the 2006 recipient of the Black Caucus of the American Library Association Fiction Honor Award.

To RSVP: http://cgi.umd.edu/survey/display?omsewebforms/whlewisreadingrsvp

This event is a part of OMSE's Black History Month Academic Series.

Website: www.omse.umd.edu

For more information, contact:

Tunji Sawyer, MBA

Office of Multi-Ethnic Student Education

+1 301 405 5619

tsawyer@umd.edu
